result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary J Otis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered a DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.
Pay $300 fine PLUS all applicable costs and fees including DNA, by 05-26-17.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary J Otis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.Court ordered defendant to pay $300.00 FINE plus all applicable court costs and fees (including DNA) by May 26, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.


Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Mary J Otis in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Mary J Otis in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case in court for Calendar call.  Defense requests status conference date.  Court withdraw stayed bench warrant.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed State's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed Motion in Limine
Received and Filed Demand for Discovery

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case calendar for final pre-trial.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Jury Trial vacated for May 4, 2016 at 9:00am.  Calendar call scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mary J Otis in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for final pre-trial. New Attorney has partial discovery and is missing 23 (twenty-three) photographs from the state.  Case will be reset for jury trial date. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 31. Court ordered February 8, 2016 at 9:00 a.m. jury trial date vacated.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mary J Otis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

 Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests jury trial. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
   DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (09/26/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Mary J Otis in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mary J Otis
Current: 3209 N. 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 09-25-2015)
Prior: 3378 North 27th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/25/15 @ 1:30 pm
